thread.title: SpaceX announces plans to go to the Moon next year
thread.title_full: SpaceX announces plans to go to the Moon next year

author: CHRISTOPHER BRENNAN
title: SpaceX announces plans to go to the Moon next year
text:
SpaceX announces plans to go to the Moon next year SpaceX announces plans to go to the Moon next year SpaceX has announced that it is planning a lunar mission next year. (BrianEKushner/Getty Images/iStockphoto) Updated: Monday, February 27, 2017, 5:13 PM 
SpaceX has chosen to go to the Moon. 
The Elon Musk private space flight company announced Monday that it will fly two wealthy passengers on a flight to the night sky’s most familiar object late next year. 
“We expect to conduct health and fitness tests, as well as begin initial training later this year. Other flight teams have also expressed strong interest and we expect more to follow,” SpaceX said in a statement. 
SpaceX's as-of-yet unidentified astronauts, who have "already paid a significant deposit to do a moon mission,"will try to do a trip around the Moon on a Dragon 2 spacecraft, which has largely funded by NASA. 
The announcement comes after SpaceX fired a rocket from the space agency's platform famously used in the lunar missions, which had not seen a flight since the space shuttle program ended six years ago. The SpaceX Falcon rocket launches from the Kennedy Space Center in Florida earlier this month. (Craig Bailey/AP) 
That launch was the first SpaceX Florida flight since one of its rockets exploded last summer. 
SpaceX said Monday that it will launch an uncrewed mission to the International Space Station on the Dragon 2 later this year before adding people on board next spring. 
This is a developing story and will be updated Join the Conversation:
